;美国国务院高级官员周一表示，美国、日本、澳大利亚尽管韩国对四方框架表现出兴趣，但印度没有立即计划扩大四方集团的规模。

;

;“短期内没有计划扩大四方集团的正式成员资格。”负责东亚和太平洋事务的副助理国务卿卡米尔·道森 (Camille Dawson) 在东京对记者表示。

;

;这位来访的官员补充道，这一观点是四个成员国之间的“共识”。

;

;在她发表上述言论之前，韩国一名高级官员在三月份表示愿意参加以美国为首的集团工作组，该工作组被广泛视为对抗中国在印太地区日益增长的军事和经济影响力。< /p>;

;道森表示，她“不知道有任何国家”要求或建议成为正式成员，同时强调四方会谈旨在促进与其他国家在各个领域的合作，以解决与北京有关的问题。

;

; p>;

;她还表示，四方不会成为本周五在华盛顿附近戴维营举行的美国、日本和韩国三边峰会上的“讨论的主要话题”。

;

;布林肯表示美国“不被乌克兰战争分散注意力”，四方提供来自中国的“选择”

;

;自去年 5 月上任以来，韩国总统尹锡烈政府优先考虑与美国和日本的三边安全合作作为应对措施

;

;上周五，美国、日本、澳大利亚和印度海军在悉尼开始马拉巴尔联合防御演习，这是澳大利亚首次在该地区举办军演。中国在该地区的自信日益增强。

;

;四方国家将于 8 月 21 日在悉尼港和澳大利亚东海岸举行联合训练，包括海上和防空演习，约有 2,000 名人员参加，其中包括约 170 名日本人

;

;在周四演习前的新闻发布会上，这四个国家的海军指挥官呼吁在该地区活动的所有各方以透明的方式行事，以支持基于规则的国际秩序。

;

;海上自卫队自卫队总司令斋藤明中将告诉记者，在广阔的近海训练区进行演习的能力“极大地有助于提高海上自卫队的能力”。

;

;美国海军第七舰队司令卡尔·托马斯中将在新闻发布会上表示，这次演习“不针对任何一个国家”，将重点改进四个国家互操作的能力。

;

;“我们四个国家作为四国共同行动所提供的威慑力是在该地区行动的所有其他国家的基础，”托马斯说。

;

;“ p>;

;来自澳大利亚、美国和日本的导弹驱逐舰以及一艘印度护卫舰与澳大利亚 F-35A 隐形战斗机和 P-8A 侦察机一起参加此次演习。

;预计对巴基斯坦中国工人的袭击不会对经济产生重大影响分析人士表示，在最近的袭击事件发生后，两国之间的合作得到了加强。

;

;周日，中国驻俾路支省领事馆称，一支由 23 名中国工程师组成的车队，乘坐四辆防弹车，在前往俾路支省瓜达尔港的途中遭到叛乱分子袭击。卡拉奇说。

;

;分裂主义叛乱组织俾路支解放军后来声称对此负责。

;

;“像这样的袭击事件，加上其他安全事件，将对建设造成一定影响。”兰州大学政治与国际关系学院教授朱永标表示：“中巴经济走廊的影响，特别是对个人投资者而言……[当涉及到]风险评估时。”但他表示，影响由于中国和巴基斯坦一开始就考虑到了此类安全威胁，而且在发生一系列致命袭击后，过去两年对中国工人的保护有所改善。

;

;“[这些保护努力]包括派出部队保护中国人员、设施、企业……并提前侦破大量未遂恐怖袭击事件。”他说。

;

;据巴基斯坦武装部队称，两名袭击者被护送的安全部队击毙。

;

;巴基斯坦启动中国设计的35亿美元核能项目

;

;中国驻巴基斯坦大使馆“强烈谴责这一恐怖行为，并要求巴基斯坦

;

;针对此次袭击事件，中国外交部发言人汪文斌周一表示：“任何破坏中巴友谊、破坏中巴基础设施建设的行为中巴经济走廊永远不会成功。”

;

;以瓜达尔港为核心的中巴经济走廊是北京“一带一路”倡议下最大的项目，也是标志性基础设施项目已在全球投资数十亿美元。

;

;中国的投资和影响力已成为俾路支解放军的目标。

;

;该组织对瓜达尔港的敌意越来越强烈该项目自 2013 年启动以来一直在参与该项目，并声称对 2021 年另一起针对中国工程师车队的自杀式爆炸事件负责，造成两人死亡、三人受伤，其中包括一名中国公民。

;

;去年 4 月，发生了一起自杀式爆炸事件叛乱组织的袭击者在卡拉奇一所孔子学院附近杀死了四人。

;

;西安西北大学中东研究所副所长严伟表示，巴基斯坦政府频繁更迭，国家安全形势严峻。经济问题导致该恐怖组织变得更加活跃。

;

;他表示，该组织袭击中国目标的目的是“干扰中巴合作，希望获得更多权利甚至独立”。

;

;但它未能产生重大影响，因为其袭击是“零星的”，而两国有着悠久的合作历史。

;

;严说，中国在瓜达尔港的项目从长远来看，港口实际上可能对俾路支省有利。

;

;“例如，如果中国和巴基斯坦能够在俾路支省进行有效合作，并通过瓜达尔港促进南亚贸易，这实际上可能有利于解决问题” ”

;

;中国强调共同威胁，推动伊朗与巴基斯坦接触

;

;兰州大学的朱同时表示塔利班两年前在阿富汗上台也加深了北京和伊斯兰堡之间的安全合作。

;

;“随着中国和巴基斯坦之间的沟通变得更加顺畅（接管后），[恐怖主义威胁]的早期发现得到了改善。 ]，”朱说。

;

;“去年卡拉奇孔子学院遇袭事件实际上是另一个转折点，我们注意到巴方为更好地保护中国利益做出了努力。”

;美国与中国之间“极端竞争”的现状，新加坡第二号领导人黄循财周一警告称，如果双方相互使用​​经济惩罚措施，可能会给全球经济带来“灾难性的”。

;

;在一次内容广泛的对话会议上，副总理黄循财表示，他相信西方针对北京获取尖端技术的各种限制不太可能“压制中国”。

;

;黄说，华盛顿的对华政策将成为“世界的大问题”。

;

;鉴于美国已决定与中国进行“极端竞争”，新加坡担心“可能会出现问题，而且问题是动态的，因为一个国家做了某事，另一个国家可能会采取报复”，黄说。

;

;美国、中国存在“不可调和的分歧”，但可以共存：新加坡部长

;

;在纪念已故独立领袖李光耀诞辰 100 周年的活动上发表讲话时，黄指出，当谈到安全方面，各国普遍意识到使用某些武器会造成附带损害。但他表示，由于世界在双边争端中使用金融措施的经验不多（就像当前中美竞争的情况一样），因此使用金融措施所造成的“附带损害”尚不清楚。

;

;“由于中美之间的极端竞争而产生的动态将导致我们走上一条对全球经济来说是灾难性的道路，”黄说。

;

;在最新的发展中，超级大国竞争中，美国总统乔·拜登上周签署了一项行政命令，禁止美国在计算机芯片等敏感技术领域对中国进行新的投资，其他行业则需要得到官方批准。

;

;拜登限制美国对中国科技的投资，使得“紧急”声明

;

;当被问及西方技术限制对中国的影响时，新加坡副总理表示，中国的各种现代化努力 — — 包括其军事 — — 不太可能脱轨。

;

;“在性能、功耗、可靠性方面都需要权衡——但你可以设计一个解决方案，”Wong 说。 “是的，这会在一定程度上减缓中国获得高端能力的速度，但这不会永远让中国陷入困境。”

;

;在会议上，黄还谈到了最近发生的一系列丑闻。扰乱了他的执政党人民行动党（PAP）。交通部长伊斯瓦兰 (S. Iswaran) 于 7 月因腐败调查被捕，而前议长和国会议员则因婚外情于同月辞职。

;

;观察人士表示，这些传奇故事集体损害了人民行动党维护人民行动党的声誉。高标准的廉洁，并可能导致权力从总理李显龙向其指定继任者黄的移交进一步推迟。

;

;黄去年被任命为人民行动党第二号领导人，之后在前任继承人王瑞杰表示他不再想竞选下一任总理之后，该党陷入了一段不确定的时期。

;

;受到对话主持人兼 CNN 主播法里德·扎卡里亚 (Fareed Zakaria) 的追问关于他从人民行动党最近的挫折中得到的教训，黄说，他从自己在政府的更广泛的经验中学到了“保持平静的感觉”。

;

;“当事情进展顺利时，当事情对我们来说进展顺利时，人们称赞我们，说我们是第一，我们是‘黄金标准’，”黄说，并补充说，党不能“让这种想法进入我们的脑海”。他说，另一方面，当它们是挑战时，向它们学习很重要。

;

;当扎卡里亚问及如果台湾受到中国大陆攻击新加坡将采取什么立场时，黄说他不想陷入假设的情况。他强调新加坡坚持一个中国政策，就像该地区其他国家一样。

;

;在谈到对俄罗斯-乌克兰战争的预测时，黄说新加坡“没有密切关注此事，因为它不属于我们的范围”地区”，但预测短期内看不到解决方案。

;中国电信巨头华为技术有限公司否认了多元化发展房地产的报道，此前有人猜测工商登记数据库显示其已成立一家房地产投资公司，引发了该事件。

;

;这家总部位于深圳的公司在一份声明中表示，其全资子公司东莞唐亚实业投资有限公司的设立主要是为了建设该项目。

;

;华为上周在中国新闻聚合平台今日头条的官方账户上发表声明称，“不会经营任何外部房地产业务。”天眼查等工商登记信息提供商发现，东莞唐雅的记录显示，该企业为华为投资部门全资拥有，且其经营范围业务涵盖住宅和商业物业租赁、园区管理服务和项目管理服务。

;

;2021年，华为表示不会成为房地产开发商。 “华为不会开发房地产，但我们的智能家居设备已经通过鸿蒙操作系统连接了家里的一切，”时任华为轮值董事长、现任监事会主席郭平在给员工的备忘录中表示。已发布在公司网站上。 “这就是我们与世界上最大的行业建立联系的方式，”他说道，同时补充说，房地产是世界上最大的行业，其次是汽车和智能手机行业。

;

;华为，简要介绍了超越三星和苹果，成为全球最大的智能手机供应商，在受到美国制裁的打击后，一直在实现业务组合多元化。华为于2019年被美国政府禁止从美国供应商购买软件、芯片和其他技术，这使其一度利润丰厚的智能手机业务陷入困境。

;

;华为借助人工智能运营重振智能手机业务其多元化努力包括与中国汽车制造商合作推出电动汽车（EV）品牌Aito，以及为企业和政府客户提供云计算、人工智能（AI）技术和其他软件服务。上个月，华为凭借第三代盘古模型加入了炙手可热的人工智能行业，该模型专注于煤炭开采、金融和政府等行业。

;

;同时，华为也没有放弃手机业务。 ，并宣布其旗舰智能手机正在“卷土重来”，本月早些时候发布了华为自研操作系统最新版本 HarmonyOS 4 的更新。

;

;这些努力似乎得到了回报华为表示，2023年上半年其总收入增长3.1%，达到3109亿元人民币（431亿美元），增长速度快于第一季度和去年同期。

;<该公司报告称，2023 年上半年，包括 Aito 品牌智能手机和电动汽车在内的消费者业务集团销售额增长 2.2%，达到 1035 亿元人民币，而智能汽车解决方案的收入达到 10 亿元人民币。< /p>; Mon, 14 Aug 2023 20:50:02 +0800 China investment: Beijing hones in on biotech in fresh pitch to woo foreign businesshttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3231056/china-investment-beijing-hones-biotech-fresh-pitch-woo-foreign-business?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.14 20:00;
;;

;中国采取新措施吸引外国投资者，并保证加强研发生物技术产业和“快速通道”跨境数据流动。

;

;中国国务院更新了投资便利化政策，为外国企业发放商务签证和提供税收优惠，旨在“改善外国投资者的商业环境并促进外国直接投资”（FDI）。

;

;周日晚间发布的 24 点指导方针清单包括对生物技术行业投资的具体支持，强调了这一点文件称，“[我们]鼓励外国投资者在中国设立研发中心……并支持他们参与重大科研项目” ，并补充说，在国外上市的生物制药的临床试验和产品注册也将变得更加高效。

;

;随着发货量的下滑，去风险、回流削弱了中国的出口

;

;该文件这是在北京采取一系列努力重振疲软的国民经济之际推出的，尽管新年伊始就取消了流行病限制，但国民经济仍在苦苦挣扎。

;

;另一项促进私营部门投资的措施是随着私人和外国投资继续下降，中国经济规划师于 7 月下旬发布了这一报告。

;

;在周一的新闻发布会上，商务部部长助理陈春江表示，政府正在寻找“采购新合作模式”，北京愿意鼓励和支持想要投资“世界领先”的中国创新的外国人。

;

;工业和信息化部规划司司长姚军科技部在同一场新闻发布会上表示，政府将继续推动“先进制造”和“节能环保”等领域的外商直接投资。他表示，北京希望鼓励更多外商直接投资中国中西部和东北地区。

;

;最新的国务院文件还表示，将为满足特定条件的外国投资者设立“快速通道”。文件称，“跨境数据传输的安全审查将提高效率，并鼓励数据的自由和安全流动。”

;

;这一含糊的誓言是在代表西方在华商业利益的团体长期以来提出不明确或模棱两可的政策之际提出的，这些政策可能会被解释，从而降低中国对投资者的吸引力。

;

;使问题复杂化。近年来，北京一直在出台新的法律，加强对跨境数据传输的控制，对未经授权收集、处理、存储或使用数据的行为实施严厉处罚，同时增加对“重要”离岸数据传输的安全审查。这些举措只会加剧在中国多个行业运营的外国公司的担忧。

;

;政府在文件中表示，将支持外国公司在“标准制定”过程中获得更多“平等待遇”和公共采购。国务院呼吁地方政府保护外国企业的权利，并要求外国投资者“举报”如果他们认为自己的商业利益因“不公平待遇”而受到损害。

;

;中国投资者转向外国资产随着当地经济衰退，股价保持平稳

;

;许多外国商会表示，他们特别欢迎鼓励研发的政策保证（例如为外国高管提供优惠的税收政策和签证）以及安全跨境方面的进步数据传输，因为这些一直是其成员最关心的问题。然而，许多人表示，观察这些承诺如何落实还需要时间。

;

;中国德国商会华北分会执行董事兼董事会成员延斯·希尔德布兰特 (Jens Hildebrandt) 表示，中国的开放电信、公共采购和药品等一系列“关键领域”的规定“如果实施将受到高度欢迎”。

;

;生物技术行业——包括生物制药——已成为中美关系恶化的主要战场之一随着美国去年宣布一项行政命令，称其为需要审查和批准的关键技术，引发了人们对中美在这一领域投资前景的担忧。

;

;随着新政府任期的开始三月份，北京已将促进外国直接投资确定为中国经济复苏的主要支柱之一。

;

; Mon, 14 Aug 2023 19:20:03 +0800 Chinese eco-warrior reporter Chai Jing back in the censorship spotlight with terrorism serieshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/politics/article/3231049/chinese-eco-warrior-reporter-chai-jing-back-censorship-spotlight-terrorism-series?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.14 19:05;
;;

;A former prominent Chinese TV reporter who disappeared from the public eye eight years ago after releasing a documentary about air pollution in China has resurfaced overseas with a new series – on terrorism.

;

;Chai Jing, who became a household name in China as a reporter for state broadcaster CCTV before financing her own productions, announced her return to journalism by releasing a trailer for the series Stranger – Talking to Jihadists on various Chinese social media platforms on Sunday.

;

;But the Chinese-language trailer and a short article published with it were removed by censors within hours for “unqualified publication of current affairs news”, a reference to a February 2021 regulation issued by internet regulator the Cyberspace Administration of China.

;

;The six-part series on the origins of terrorism will be released on Thursday.

;

;In the article, Chai said she moved to Barcelona, Spain in 2017 but did not say why she had kept a low profile since 2015.

;

;The article pointed to a personal channel on YouTube, a service that is blocked in mainland China.

;

;Chai, 47, is one of a number of Chinese journalists who left behind the constrained news system at home to pursue a career abroad. Wang Zhian, another former CCTV journalist, started his own YouTube channel after moving to Japan in 2020.

;

;In her 2015 documentary , Chai interviewed officials and researchers about air pollution, calling on the public to take remedial action.

;

;It was released in the lead-up to annual national legislature meetings in March and had more than 200 million views in two days, helped in part by official media outlets, including People's Daily.

;

;Chen Jining, the environmental protection minister at the time, reportedly sent Chai a text message to thank her for focusing attention on environmental problems.

;

;The documentary generated widespread public debate before it was taken down by censors without explanation.

;

;There was also no indication of how it managed to slip through China's strictly censored internet regime to be released in the first place.

;

;Chai had not been seen publicly since.

;

;Chai was a reporter and presenter for state broadcaster CCTV from 2001 to 2013, where she made a name through investigative reports, particularly during the Sars epidemic in 2003 and the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake.

;

;News site Sina News reported in 2014 that Chai left CCTV that year.

;

;Her bestselling memoir Seeing, first published in China in 2012, will be released in English next week by New York-based Astra Publishing House.

;

;Chai's reappearance sparked widespread discussion on social media.

;

;“It is inspiring to see Chai drifting for years but still working,” one commenter wrote in a post that was reposted by more than 4,000 people before being taken down.

;

;Additional reporting by Echo Xie

; Mon, 14 Aug 2023 19:20:03 +0800 Singapore must be alert to China and US stepping up their ‘battle of narratives’: ex-diplomatshttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3231035/singapore-must-be-alert-china-and-us-stepping-their-battle-narratives-ex-diplomats?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.14 17:55;
;;

;Singapore must be prepared for China and the United States to intensify their “battle of narratives” as they seek to influence public opinion in the city state, two of its veteran diplomats have said.

;

;The topic of foreign interference – by China in particular – was among the key issues raised by a panel discussing the future of Singapore's foreign policy, as part of an Institute of Policy Studies conference on Monday to commemorate the 100th birth anniversary of Singapore's late founding prime minister Lee Kuan Yew.

;

;Speaking at the conference, Chan Heng Chee, Singapore's ambassador-at-large, referred to a recent Washington Post report that alleged Beijing is seeking to sway the views of the island republic towards Beijing's positions on various issues.

;

;The report said various Chinese individuals and entities aim to do so through Singapore's Chinese-language Lianhe Zaobao newspaper, and its clan and business associations.

;

;Taiwan the 'most dangerous flashpoint' in US-China rivalry, Singapore PM says

;

;Chan said Singapore was “well aware of these activities and the government is constantly vigilant against agents of influence of all countries”. She added that local officials had previously uncovered “blackbox [activities] targeting our population, seeking to manipulate sentiments”.

;

;Foreign interference activities have been highlighted in the past few years by Singapore's leaders, including Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loon, and Law and Home Affairs Minister K. Shanmugam. These leaders, however, did not name any country behind such activities, although several analysts have said China was a key player.

;

;Chan, who was Singapore's former ambassador to the US, suggested that senior Washington officials were likely to consider reports about Chinese influence operations more seriously.

;

;She said some top thinkers in the US believed that Southeast Asia was not too concerned about Chinese interference activities in the region, and they expect Washington to take stronger action to counter Beijing.

;

;“We should be prepared for a stepped-up battle of narratives, much more than currently evident,” Chan said.

;

;While she conceded that Singapore could not be involved in the battle between the two superpowers for regional influence, it was important for the city state to continue its policy of speaking up on key issues that affect other countries arising from the rivalry. The city state must not take sides between Washington and Beijing and be firm to say “no” to either government where necessary, she added.

;

;Bilahari Kausikan, a former permanent secretary in the Singapore foreign ministry, agreed with Chan's remarks at the conference, saying it was a challenge that did not provide “definitive” solutions.

;

;In the battleground between two behemoths, “you just have to keep mowing the lawn because the grass will keep growing”, Kausikan said.

;

;“This is not a fight that will be won by a few speeches by senior leaders. The fight has to be continually fought at the grassroots level because that is where the problem lies – including among some grassroots leaders,” he added.

;

;The two envoys' remarks come after the Washington Post's report on July 24 sparked considerable debate in Singapore and beyond.

;

;The US newspaper said a joint study it conducted with the Australia Strategic Policy Institute showed that the Lianhe Zaobao newspaper “now routinely echoes some of Beijing's most strident falsehoods”, including “denying evidence” of rights abuses in Xinjiang and alleging that protests in Hong Kong and in mainland China were instigated by foreign forces. The report also said the newspaper typically leaned towards Beijing's positions in the China-US rivalry.

;

;The Lianhe Zaobao – which has close links with the Singapore establishment – has refuted the allegations. Current Singapore ambassador to the US, Lui Tuck Yew, told the Washington Post in a letter that “it was wrong to expect Zaobao to resemble the Washington Post or for Singapore to follow either the US or China”.

;

;Singapore's government in 2021 passed a law targeting foreign interference activities, with ministers speaking in Parliament about the need for residents to guard against influence operations regardless of their source.

;

;In his annual national policy address last year, Prime Minister Lee warned citizens to “actively guard” against foreign influence efforts including on social media, stressing the importance of guarding the city state's sovereignty. His remarks on the issue were delivered during his Mandarin and English speeches.

;A kindergarten teacher in central China who was forcibly paraded on the street as a humiliation by a student's mother after being exposed for having an affair with her husband has trended on mainland social media.

;

;In a viral video taken on a street in Changsha, Hunan province, earlier this month, a young woman is seen being pulled by her hair and has her arms tightly held by another woman who yells loudly to passers-by: “Look, everyone! She is a mistress”, Wanqu Video reported.

;

;“I don't fear feeling ashamed because I haven't done anything disgraceful. They should be ashamed. She slept with my husband in our new home, and I caught them on site,” the wife said.

;

;“She is the home-room teacher of my daughter. Her family name is Jiang. She is the scum of the teaching community.”

;

;The teacher said nothing in the video but later, apparently under coercion – posted the video on her WeChat account twice, confirming the wife's claims against her.

;

;“I am a mistress. I had an affair with a student's father, and we were caught by his wife at their new home. I am shameless. I beg for the forgiveness of his wife,” confessed the teacher.

;

;“Everyone, please forward this post so that I will be rejected by society.”

;

;The kindergarten said the teacher had quit after the incident, the report said.

;

;According to an online chat group for residents, the teacher's boyfriend reported the wife's treatment of his girlfriend to the police and did not believe the affair claims. The police have not commented on the case so far.

;

;A neighbour said the wife has three children with her husband and had been busy looking after her father-in-law, who is in hospital, while the husband conducted the affair.

;

;The video has been viewed 96 million times on Weibo, with most commenters siding with the wife.

;

;“Why not drag her husband along to join the procession together?” asked one person.

;

;“How unfortunate this woman is! I sympathise with her, but she still broke the law by humiliating another person in public,” said another commenter.

;

;Stories about women confronting cheating husbands and their lovers are popular online in China and usually draw sympathy for the cheated-on spouse.

;

;In June, pedestrians in northern China's Hebei province helped a woman stop her husband's car after seeing her being dragged along a road following her confrontation with the pair in the car.

;

;Last year, a crowd in Hebei province cheered for a wife who caught her cheating husband and his lover together in a car and smashed its window with a brick.

;

;JR Central has said shinkansen services between Tokyo and Nagoya stations will be greatly reduced on Tuesday and the bullet trains will mostly operate without seat reservations.

;

;Japan Airlines said 19 flights, including to and from Itami airport in Western Japan, had been cancelled on Monday, with 240 flights on Tuesday also cancelled, affecting around 24,800 people.

;

;All Nippon Airways said 310 flights will be cancelled on Tuesday, with most to and from Itami airport.

;

;Meanwhile, Universal Studios Japan's theme park in Osaka will be closed on Tuesday, its operator said, adding that although the park plans to be open on Wednesday, the opening time may be delayed.

;

;At 5pm, the typhoon was located about 150km southeast of Cape Shionomisaki in Wakayama Prefecture and moving northwestward.

;

;It had an atmospheric pressure of 970 hectopascals with winds packing up to 180km per hour, the Japan Meteorological Agency said.

;

;The typhoon's approach coincided with the return rush of Bon holidaymakers.

;

;Many people were travelling during the major holiday period for the first time since Covid-19 was legally downgraded to the same category as seasonal flu.

;

;On Sunday, some train stations, airports and roads were congested with people opting to travel home from their Bon holidays earlier than planned.
